title: 325btc
author: 325btc
content: Therr is too much focus on gas oil a.d energy.But only what matters who controls currencyUsa is reserve currency and thats it.Usa dollar and usa army nothing else really matters World is full of oil full of food and full of energy and gaz.Anyone who spread news shortages its a joke.Big joke just this russia oil gaz joke...eu dont cry about it world is full of gaz oil.Food shortages...give me brake do we have limits on cows?Or fruits not grow? Cmon...go any tropical land and u see a lot bananas grow.Food shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.News spread full of nonsense and its all joke world is full of resources.We only are shortage of fiat currency if central banks do rate hikes....also higher rates making usd stronger so less money so money shortages not food shortages.Lets stop this nonsenss e talk food there is a lot food oil gas world is full of it.

comments.author: Gyfts
comments.body: Quote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 06:07:07 PMFood shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.The people that die from famine aren't the fat cows that live in developed countries, unable to walk up a flight of steps without being out of breath. It's people in developing countries that don't have the luxury of being able to go to a restaurant or grocery store which has a stockpile of food, resupplied by a functioning supply chain on a moments notice.The Germans and others in Europe will find out how important energy is when they're freezing during the winter time. Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences.

comments.author: BCwinning
comments.body: Quote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMQuote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 06:07:07 PMFood shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences. Just like the world putting their manufacturing basket in China, it has come back to bite them. Everything has a consequence. Europe should have been preparing for this since 2014/crimea but they don't learn from their history..

comments.author: 325btc
comments.body: Quote from: BCwinning on July 20, 2022, 07:12:08 PMQuote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMQuote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 06:07:07 PMFood shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences. Just like the world putting their manufacturing basket in China, it has come back to bite them. Everything has a consequence. Europe should have been preparing for this since 2014/crimea but they don't learn from their history.. Well china is the producer we cant put manufactories in other places air pollution.Over the france monaco cannes st tropez and marbella spain and switzerland italy...nice resorts for example its not suitable for manufactoring to have any factory near to those vacation areaas where people enjoy quality life and clean air no pollution not even consideration to have factories near by france germany or italy only few.Europe dont want air pollution usa dont want uk dont want neither canada dont want.But natural resources its not a problem ukraine have and latin america also south europe all we need and gaz can get it from norway

comments.author: Gyfts
comments.body: Quote from: BCwinning on July 20, 2022, 07:12:08 PMQuote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMQuote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 06:07:07 PMFood shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences. Just like the world putting their manufacturing basket in China, it has come back to bite them. Everything has a consequence. Europe should have been preparing for this since 2014/crimea but they don't learn from their history.. Someone did try to warn them. Donald Trump was laughed at by the Germans for his warning in 2018: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1JpwkeTBwgsI suppose the Germans will not be laughing so much during winter time. Says a lot about centralization too, doesn't it? Had Germany diversified their energy sources, there wouldn't be a reliance on Russia.I think you're right about China. Too much of the western world depends on their cheap manufacturing. It can't last forever.

There are stats which reveals lots of people are dying everyday due to hunger and many children have nutrition deficiency due to the shortage of food so in real world these things are real.

comments.author: BCwinning
comments.body: Quote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 11:12:51 PMQuote from: BCwinning on July 20, 2022, 07:12:08 PMQuote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMQuote from: 325btc on July 20, 2022, 06:07:07 PMFood shortages? Go resteraunt kitchen see how much FOOD they just trhow away.Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences. Just like the world putting their manufacturing basket in China, it has come back to bite them. Everything has a consequence. Europe should have been preparing for this since 2014/crimea but they don't learn from their history.. Well china is the producer we cant put manufactories in other places air pollution.Over the france monaco cannes st tropez and marbella spain and switzerland italy...nice resorts for example its not suitable for manufactoring to have any factory near to those vacation areaas where people enjoy quality life and clean air no pollution not even consideration to have factories near by france germany or italy only few.Europe dont want air pollution usa dont want uk dont want neither canada dont want.But natural resources its not a problem ukraine have and latin america also south europe all we need and gaz can get it from norwayYes we can, air pollution is a very small factor in this, the big factor here is called greed., Why pay a 1st world wage and everything that comes with it when you can pay someone a dollar a day (+/- a few pennies)to manufacture. Greed also plays a part with the air pollution, who wants to spend the money doing the right thing when you can just bribe the locals in China and dump your waste into rivers and the air with no consequences in the short term. Follow the companies and where they built, they chase the lowest wage. Back in the 80's it was taiwan where cheap goods came out of, than it slowly moved to China where it stands today but not for long. Companies are learning to not stick all their base into one location finally.All those resort locations you listed, never ever was a manufacturing hub.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMThe Germans and others in Europe will find out how important energy is when they're freezing during the winter time. Their green energy initiatives will bite them severely. I suppose relying on a senile dictator for cheap energy has its consequences.Quote from: BCwinning on July 20, 2022, 07:12:08 PMEurope should have been preparing for this since 2014/crimea but they don't learn from their history.. =Germany linked to and made its economy dependent on Russia after world war 2. Everything happened recently, one century ago. If you agree with me, you may ask: Well then, Germans haven't changed, have they? Probably, not. Some part of people think that Germans have changed but waitWhy did Germany start the world war? To conquer the whole of Europe. Germany got destroyed because it was fighting 360o and Hitler wasn't that smart, he was a bad decision maker with very intelligent people around him.Germany's plan was to conquer Europe. Do you think it failed? Germany got destroyed to death but quickly become the world's fourth-largest economy.So, think twice! In reality, Germany achieved 50% of its original plan. Germany united Europe. At the moment Europe is under the influence of Germany and France, this was the aim of Germany but recently they did it in a civil way, still didn't perform it solo but the situation behind the scene is different from the actual scenes. Britain failed, they did Brexit and they regret it. A lot of brits want to join Europe. In order to do this, they will have to throw away their GBP and accept the Euro, a currency controlled by France and Germany. Rule N1: adopting the euro is an important step of EU membership.Lenin was a German agent that made revolution in Russia. Well, Putin served as an officer of the KGB in the East German. This along with the fact that Germany linked its economics with Russia makes me think that the politics and aims of Germany haven't changed in reality but their tactics have really changed.Am I crazy for this opinion? Probably yes, probably no, judge yourself but think twice!Quote from: Gyfts on July 20, 2022, 07:06:02 PMThe Germans and others in Europe will find out how important energy is when they're freezing during the winter time.Probably yes, we may "Freeze" but there is a price that has to be paid. The more you want, the more you pay.

That we all know all ready nothing new about it.It just russia and germany do the energy racket over europe for others.Lenin was germany yes all kgb was created by germany we all know th a t thats true

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: ^^^ So now we are starting to see what this war really is. The Ukraine military was full of Nazi's, and would be now if they hadn't been killed off as much as they have by the Russian Nazi's.It's a complete civil war. It is a civil war by the Ukraine/Russia war. It is civil war by the Russian Nazi's who want to at least say they are Communist, against the Ukraine Nazi's who want to be Nazi on the outside as well as the inside.It's all Nazi's, fighting for the right to be the best Nazi state. This is good. Let the Nazi's kill themselves all off and be gone. The world would be a much better place without any Nazi's.
